headline: Rivian, Wayfair, and 7 More Stocks That Could Join the Meme Trade
summary: Kohl’s came into July with 53 million shares shorted, or about 47% of shares outstanding, according to FactSet.  It doesn’t require being Albert Einstein to suggest that Kohl’s stock is seeing a short-squeeze.  Retail traders often try to push heavily-shorted stocks higher, forcing short sellers to buy back shares, creating large gains.

headline: Kohl’s Looks Like a Meme Stock Now. Rivian, Birkenstock, and Others Could Follow.
summary: Kohl’s  stock has gone bonkers, and meme stocks look to be back in fashion.  Shares of Kohl’s almost doubled at the market’s open Tuesday morning, though its gain moderated to “only” 35% by midday.  Kohl’s came into July with 53 million shares shorted, or about 47% of shares outstanding, according to FactSet.
